business.headline: Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

entertainment.headline: Munawar Faruqui's son hospitalised, wife Mehzabeen shares update in touching postComedian Munawar Faruqui is facing a personal challenge as his son Mikael battles a viral infection. His partner, Mehzabeen Coatwala, shared the update on social media.

Aayush Sharma reflects on back surgeries, says ignored body's signsActor Aayush Sharma expressed that a six-pack body is not a fit body and shared his experience of undergoing two back surgeries. He also stated that his time at the hospital helped him bond with his family.

Superman box office Day 2: James Gunn film soars past F1, Jurassic World in IndiaJames Gunn's 'Superman' starring David Corenswet has made a strong debut at the Indian box office, earning Rs 9.25 crore on its second day and leading over recent Hollywood and Bollywood releases.

Jackie Shroff joins Kartik Aaryan's Tu Meri Main Tera, fans say OG with Gen Z heroActors Kartik Aaryan and Jackie Shroff are all set to team up for the upcoming film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. The announcement video sparked excitement amongst fans on social media. In the film, Aaryan is paired opposite actor Ananya Panday.

Kota Srinivasa Rao dies: Chiranjeevi, Pawan Kalyan attend funeral, pay tributeProminent Tollywood stars gathered to pay their respects to late Telugu icon Kota Srinivasa Rao on Sunday. He died at 83, leaving behind a rich legacy in Indian cinema with over 750 films across multiple languages.

Amaal Mallik on distancing from family: Mother would compare my journey with ArmaanSinger Amaal Mallik shared that he cut ties with his parents due to constant comparisons with his brother, Armaan Malik. However, he clarified that he shares no issues with the latter and continues to have a strong bond with him.

Actor Vanessa Hudgens announces second pregnancy with husband Cole TuckerVanessa Hudgens and her husband Cole Tucker are thrilled to announce they are expecting their second child, sharing the joyful news on Instagram. The couple, who welcomed their first child last year, are eagerly preparing to embrace the next chapter of parenthood together.

Maalik vs Aankhon box office Day 2: Rajkummar's film shows growth, Vikrant's lagsRajkummar Rao's gangster drama 'Maalik' is making a strong mark at the box office with rising collections and positive word of mouth. In contrast, the romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' has seen a modest start, struggling to connect with audiences.

Anant-Radhika's 1st anniversary: SRK, Salman Khan to Ranveer Singh, celebs send loveBollywood stars Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Ranveer Singh extended their wishes to Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant on their first wedding anniversary, celebrating the grand occasion with warmth and affection.

Metro In Dino budget is half of reported Rs 85 crore: Sources'Metro... In Dino' was made on a modest Rs 40 crore budget, half of the reported Rs 85 crore. The film is steadily climbing the box office and gaining appreciation for its storytelling and realistic characters.

Chiranjeevi to Jr NTR, celebs mourn Telugu actor Kota Srinivasa Rao's deathVeteran Telugu actor and former MLA Kota Srinivasa Rao died on July 13. Following the news of his death, several prominent figures from the Telugu film industry paid heartfelt tributes.

Kota Srinivasa Rao, Telugu film icon and ex-Andhra MLA dies at 83Rao made his debut in 1978 with the Telugu film Pranam Khareedu and went on to star in over 750 feature films across Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, and other Indian languages.

Bigg Boss fame Abdu Rozik detained in Dubai over theft allegation, team denies arrestFormer 'Bigg Boss' contestant Abdu Rozik was detained at Dubai airport but not arrested, as clarified by his management team.

Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali laid to rest in LahoreThe late Pakistani model and actor Humaira Asghar Ali was laid to rest in Pakistan's Lahore on Friday. Her funeral was attended by a small gathering of people.

Love Island USA Season 7 Finale: All about when and where to watch and the finalistsAs 'Love Island USA Season 7' nears its end, four couples remain in the running for the $100,000 prize. The finale promises a dramatic conclusion as viewers await to see which couple will emerge victorious.

Actor Kushal Tandon appeals for privacy after fan intrudes his homeActor Kushal Tandon said his home was trespassed on by a fan while he was away. He expressed concern about privacy, especially since his family lives with him. The actor also urged fans to maintain mutual respect and understanding.

Kareena's car was attacked after Saif Ali Khan's stabbing incident: Ronit RoyActor Ronit Roy shared that actor Kareena Kapoor's car was attacked after her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan's hospital discharge. The actor, who manages a security agency, said this further prompted enhanced security measures.

Chhoti Bachi Ho Kya: Tiger Shroff elated over Superman x Baaghi crossoverActor Tiger Shroff expressed excitement over a reference to his film 'Baaghi' in the new 'Superman' movie. The Hindi dubbed version of the film gave a shout-out to 'Baaghi' and used the dialogue 'Chhoti Bachi Ho Kya?'.

Bella Thorne claims Charlie Puth vilified her after she refused to sleep with himAmerican actor Bella Thorne has accused singer Charlie Puth of spreading false claims about their brief relationship, following a series of social media exchanges. Both have since clarified their positions and moved on, with Thorne engaged and Puth married.

general news.headline: Migrant driver beaten by Uddhav Sena days after viral 'Bhojpuri bolunga' videoOutrage erupted in Palghar after Shiv Sena (UBT) and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena workers tracked down and thrashed a migrant rickshaw driver who had earlier refused to speak Marathi in a viral video.

Bihar Minister touts good governance as back-to-back shootings leave 3 deadThree men, including a businessman, a veterinary doctor and a grocery store owner, were shot dead across Bihar in 24 hours. The killings have raised serious concerns over law and order ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

Different day, same rot: Trinamool slams BJP after Odisha student self-immolatesA second-year college student in Odisha's Balasore set herself ablaze on campus after accusing her HOD of sexual harassment. The student sustained 90 per cent burn injuries and her condition remains to be critical.

3rd Test Day 4 Live: Can Crawley handle Gill's fiery pressure?ENG vs IND, 3rd Test Day 4 Live score: After a fiery end to Day 3 at Lord's, all eyes are on Zak Crawley and Shubman Gill as India look to make early inroads and tilt the balance in this knife-edge third Test.

How dehatism is ruining tourismDehatism is killing the experience of tourists in India and abroad. From dancing shirtless in Switzerland for a reel and dragging Vietnamese women for selfies to stripping locals of privacy in Goa's Fontainhas and drinking in public at the Rohtang Pass, dehatism is on full display. The dehatis aren't the Indians from the mofussil, but those from urban centres with big money but little sense.

Can Jannik Sinner crack the Carlos Alcaraz code in grand finale?Wimbledon: Five-time Grand Slam champion Carlos Alcaraz may have had the upper hand over Jannik Sinner, but the World No.1 Italian will be aiming to flip the script when they meet in Sunday's grand finale.

Shall I speak in Marathi? PM quips to Rajya Sabha nominee amid language rowSpeaking exclusively to India Today TV, newly-nominated Rajya Sabha MP Ujjwal Nikam said, 'He (PM Modi) started speaking in Marathi. He asked whether he should talk in Hindi or in Marathi. I started laughing. Hearing me laugh, PM Modi also started laughing.'

Radhika targeted for wearing shorts, talking to boys: Best friend slams fatherHaving known her since 2012, Himanshika claimed that Radhika was often targeted for wearing shorts, talking to boys, and living life on her own terms. In a video released by Himanshika, she revealed that Radhika's movements were tightly controlled, with fixed times for going out and returning home.

Tripura girl missing in Delhi for 6 days: No CCTV, no leads, no bank activityFollowing her disappearance, the Delhi Police, along with the National Disaster Response Force, has launched a massive search operation within a seven-kilometre radius. However, the operation yielded no results, even after a week.

26/11 prosecutor, ex-diplomat, 2 others nominated to Rajya SabhaPresident Droupadi Murmu has nominated Ujjwal Nikam, Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Meenakshi Jain and C Sadanandan Master to the Rajya Sabha to fill vacancies left by retiring members.

Several Bangladesh, Nepal, Myanmar nationals found in Bihar voter listForeign nationals from Nepal, Bangladesh, and Myanmar were found in Bihar during voter list revision; their names to be excluded after verification. Election Commission to extend voter roll revision to five more states ahead of 2026 polls.

Sinner vs Alcaraz: All you need to know about Wimbledon finalWimbledon 2025: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will lock horns on Centre Court in the summit clash of the men's singles on Sunday, July 12 at the All England Club.

UP's Chhangur Baba funded more than 1,000 Muslim men to trap Hindu girls: SourcesChhangur Baba sent payments to young men across seven districts in Uttar Pradesh via the Indo-Nepal border. He also made cash payments to Muslim men who lured Hindu girls through 'love jihad.'

PSG vs Chelsea, Club World Cup Final Livestreaming: Battle of rise vs gloryChelsea and PSG are set for a high-stakes showdown at MetLife Stadium as the FIFA Club World Cup reaches its grand finale—one chasing history, the other seeking a fresh start under new leadership.

At custodial death protest, Vijay turns star power into firepowerActor-turned-politician Vijay leads a large protest in Chennai demanding justice for Ajith Kumar's custodial death. The rally steps up political pressure on the Tamil Nadu government amid allegations of police brutality.

2025 Bajaj Pulsar NS400Z review, first ride: Most fun motorcycle under Rs 2 lakh?We first rode Bajaj's value-for-money performance streetfighter in May 2024, and now there's an update. Is the 2025 NS400Z still maximum bang for your buck?

What caused Air India crash? Expert rejects pilot error theory, questions probeMore than a month after the Ahmedabad crash that killed 241 people, aviation expert and ex-IAF Director Sanjeev Kapoor has raised serious doubts over the recently released preliminary report.

Odisha student sets herself on fire over harassment by teacher, accused arrestedAccording to fellow students, the woman had been mentally distressed for weeks, allegedly due to persistent harassment by her teacher in Odisha's Balasore.

Underrated? KL Rahul showing he is the new rock India can trust at the topF1 level mental training, calmness on the field and a return to the top. KL Rahul has become the new rock that India can trust as an opener in the Test arena.

Train carrying diesel catches fire, rail services hit near ChennaiAuthorities said the train caught fire after it derailed, although the railway police have launched an initial probe to determine the exact cause of the blaze. Visuals showed thick plumes of smoke rising from the fire, with authorities urging locals to stay away from the area.

How Trump changed a year after near-assassination: Friends, aides share insightsOne year after coming millimeters from a very different outcome, Trump, according to friends and aides, is still the same Trump. But they see signs, beyond being on higher alert on stage, that his brush with death did change him in some ways.

Lord's Test: Rahul, Jadeja drag India to parity before dramatic end to Day 3The third Test between India and England continues to hang in the balance as England finished Day 3 on 2/0 after India got all out for 387 in the first innings. KL Rahul scored a brilliant century while Rishabh Pant (74) and Ravindra Jadeja (72) also made valuable contributions.

Akash Deep review system: Pacer survives 2 LBW calls from Bangladesh umpireIndia's Akash Deep survived two consecutive LBW calls using DRS during the third Test at Lord's. His sharp reviews earned cheers from cricket fans across the world.

Beaten 0-6, 0-6, Anisimova breaks down in tears after Wimbledon FinalAmanda Anisimova was in tears during her on court interview after the Wimbledon Final. Anisimova spoke with class despite her 0-6, 0-6 loss to Iga Swiatek in the women's singles final.

Captain Mhatre steps up, scores 102 for India U19 vs England in 1st youth TestCaptain Ayush Mhatre stepped for India U-19 and scored a brilliant hundred against England in the first youth Test on Saturday, July 12. Mhatre scored 102 off 115 balls during the first innings.

Iga Swiatek hammers helpless Amanda Anisimova to win maiden titleWimbledon 2025: Iga Swiatek demolished Amanda Anisimova to win her maiden title at the All England Club. On Saturday, Swiatek took only 57 minutes to win the women's singles final 6-0, 6-0 on Centre Court.

Where does Virat Kohli rank among fab four? Kane Williamson revealsNew Zealand's batting stalwart Kane Williamson recently revealed where he ranks India's Virat Kohli among the fab four. Kohli recentlu announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the ongoing England tour.

Neeraj Chopra-Arshad Nadeem face off set for 1st time after Olympics 2024Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem are all set to renew their rivalry on the field as the India and Pakistan stars will face off at the Silselia Diamond League in Poland, which will take place on August 16.

Final Highlights: Iga Swiatek beats Amanda Anisimova 6-0, 6-0 to win titleWimbledon 2025 women's singles final Highlights: Iga Swiatek won the grass court major for the first time after beating Amanda Anisimova 6-0, 6-0 on Centre Court.

Mitchell Starc eyes special milestone in landmark 100th Test for AustraliaWI vs AUS: Mitchell Starc, playing in his 100th Test, has a chance to reach the landmark of 400 Test wickets. After winning the series 2-0, Australia will be looking for a clean-sweep in Jamaica.

After 650 days away with injury, Murali Sreeshankar returns with 8.05 m jump in PuneIndia's long jump sensation Murali Sreeshankar made a sensational return to the track as he registered an 8.05m jump in Pune during the Indian Open Athletics Championships on Saturday, July 12.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
